name: Hampton Inn & Suites Mahwah

reviews.text: I stayed at this hotel for one night and it was a wonderful experience, especially for the price. I was in the area for an event at Rockland Community College several miles away - across the state border in NY. The location is great - not far at all from my destination. The hotel is relatively new, and it shows. Both the exterior and interior look fantastic and clean.
reviews.title: Excellent hotel, especially for the value

reviews.text: My room was great - in excellent shape and also very clean. I even had a pretty good view out the window. My sleep quality was very good instead of excellent because the walls seemed somewhat thin. There was a family in the room next to mine, and I could hear the mother and very young child too well at some points. Fortunately the child must have slept well at night, and I just kept my fan (heating/cooling) on all night.
reviews.title: Service was better than most 5-Star hotels

reviews.text: The complimentary breakfast was wonderful. I had lower expectations about what was offered, especially after other hotel visits where hot breakfast was advertised but not so great. The staff was very friendly and did an excellent job - great service all around. I interacted with Norma several times and she provided excellent customer service, making me feel welcome. She did such an exemplary job that she should be commended - she is an asset to the hotel.
reviews.title: Great Value, Very kind and helpful staff.
New Property - Clean and Reasonably Priced
reviews.text: Aside from this hotel being near the customer I was visiting, I chose it because it was recently built. I had read several reviews that had given it high marks (for the reasons that matter to me) and chose to give it a try. In general, this was a great little hotel that had everything I needed to be comfortable. And aside from one noisy family that checked in later in the evening on the day I arrived (and whom Norma kindly addressed), it was very, very quiet (which was appreciated). I was greeted warmly by Thomie, the manager on duty when I arrived, and she efficiently and very politely checked me in. My key didn't work when I got up to the room so I went back down to notify her. She was very apologetic for the inconvenience and quickly re-coded me another key (that worked).

The room was very clean, new, smelled fresh and aesthetically attractive. No-name-brand shampoo, conditioner and lotion was provided in the bathroom, though there was a small sundries area near the front desk for other items that you forgot. They had OTC medicines, hair products, brushes/combs, razors, feminine products, laundry soap to use in their guest laundry room, sewing/shoeshine items and snacks (just not panty hose). :) My only complaint is that the duvet covers looked clean, but one of them had human hair in copious amounts that makes me wonder if the covers were laundered in between guests, if perhaps when they were dried the lint stuck around, or if the hair was from housekeeping. But it was quite a turnoff. The sheets, however were clean, so I just removed the hair.
reviews.title: New, Friendly, Clean, Good Value

reviews.text: Newer Hampton Inn, Rooms are OK and clean, for business purposes (just sleep in hotel and internet connection) this hotel offers good value for money
reviews.title: Nice Business hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Tip: if you want a calm room, requset one not facing the street else it can be rather noisy
reviews.title: Failed to deliver as promised

reviews.text: My wife and I have a house full of kids and grand-kids, so we like to just check into a hotel on occasion and enjoy some alone and quiet time. In many cases, we visit Hampton Inn's for these getaways, since they are almost always clean, comfortable, and have the basic amenities we want. Two amenities on which we insisted for this trip were an indoor pool and in-room on-demand movies, both of which are listed on the hotel's website. In the case of the pool, when my wife and I went to go swimming, the water was very. very cloudy, and we were reluctant to swim. We asked at the front desk, and they said it was fine for swimming, but they would contact "engineering". We decided not to risk it. A few hours later, we went back, and the pool was "closed for cleaning", so clearly there was a problem. The end result is we did not get the promised amenity. I understand these things happen, and if this were the only problem, I would write it off as bad luck.
reviews.title: GREAT PROPERTY
A-OK!
reviews.text: What is not bad luck is that the hotel's website specifically lists "TV-Pay per view" movies as an amenity (I just checked it again), but no such option is available, just basic cable and HBO. This may seem like a small thing, but we would NOT have booked this hotel if we knew that option was not available. Felt a bit like bait and switch.
I will say that otherwise the hotel is a typical Hampton Inn. Spotlessly clean and well appointed. If we were in the area for a reason other than a "get-away from home" weekend, we would return.
reviews.title: A typical Hampton Inn
New and Looks Great!
reviews.text: Very clean and well-maintained property. It looks like it was either built recently or redone. The rooms are very large and very comfortable. The hotel itself is conviniently located just off of Route 17, so getting on and off this main highway was a breeze!

reviews.title: Great convenient property
reviews.text: There is a very generous breakfast spread available in the lobby. They also have a pre-packaged breakfast brown bag for those who are in a hurry!

reviews.title: Nice and Affortable
reviews.text: The check-in process and check-out process was very quick and painless.

reviews.title: Excellent Hotel!
reviews.text: This new property is right on Highway 17 South in Mahwah, approximately 5 minutes off the New York Thruway, and 15 minutes from the Garden State Mall.

reviews.title: Really nice room
reviews.text: Like all other Hampton Inns, they have complimentary breakfast, which is limited in choice, but good quality. They also have an indoor pool and excercise room, and lots of free parking. The rooms are very quiet and well appointed.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I cannot say enough about this place! After a very poor start to a mini getaway, the staff and amenities at the Hampton Inn made up for the poor treatment we received at the SUPER 8 up the road.
reviews.title: WONDERFUL EXPERIENCE, GREAT STAFF

reviews.text: Here is what happened: We had a reservation at the SUPER 8, but did NOT stay. After driving for 4 hours, stopped at the hotel to confirm our reservation and was told "Check in is at 3." No problem - we were going to get a train into the city and knew that check in was at 3 pm. I asked if I could just use a rest room and got a flat "NO". Desk attendant (wish I had gotten her name) was rude, matter-of-fact, and had an “'I don't care if you stay here" attitude. Went down the road and CHECKED IN (no waiting until 3 pm) at the Hampton. They treated us like kings. Worth the extra money to be welcomed and treated like human beings, instead of trash. This was to be our first experience with Super 8 - and though we never even saw the room, it made a lasting impression. NEVER will we stay at a Super 8. Never.
reviews.title: Nice place. But it took 4 calls to come get someone to come to the room to look at it

reviews.text: As for the room at the Hampton Inn ... PERFECTION. They have thought of EVERYTHING for the traveler. Comfort at every level. We could not think of anything it lacked. Great soaking tubs, plenty of towels, extra EVERYTHING. Wonderful indoor pool. I could go on and on, but the absolute BEST part was the staff and how warmly we were WELCOMED. What a great experience. A special thank you to Robin Sheppard, who made sure our stay was so enjoyable!
reviews.title: Great stay!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: But it is clean and pleasant. Hard to find use a gps
reviews.title: Very pleasant stay

reviews.text: We stayed here in August 2011. Nicely renovated rooms, clean, comfortable beds. Breakfast was perfect.lots of choices: bread, bagels, English muffins, Danish, eggs, yogurt, etc.. The only issue was that it was quite busy and most of the tables were left dirty and no one came to clean them. Not a huge deal though. We would definitely stay here again when in the area.
reviews.title: you must stay here!!!

description: Ideal among hotels in Mahwah, our promise to you includes a clean, comfortable hotel room. In fact, we have 111 of them! If you're traveling with your family, you may opt for a room with two beds.
